metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7006 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.3 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.2 is affected. tvOS before 10.2.2 is affected.The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remote attackers toconduct a timing side-channel attack to bypass the Same Origin Policy andobtain sensitive information via a crafted web site that uses SVG filters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
